Body:
Currently trying to build a project in eclipse. The project explorer is shown below:

In cabbie.c I get the error
column10:
in the code below: 

#include <stdio.h>	#include <stdlib.h>	#include "../iotfclient.h"		Iotfclient client;	int rc;		int main() {	    /* Setup your example here
column11: code that should run once	     */		    rc = initialize(&client
column16:
"Over_9000"); /* Code in this loop will run repeatedly */ for (;;) { } return 0; }

The function is already defined in iotfclient.h which was included as a header file. Is it correct to define it as ../iotfclient.h? Am I supposed to make a Makefile? The function prototype in iotfclient.h is given below: 

int initialize(Iotfclient *client
column21:
char *authtoken); /** * Function used to initialize the IBM Watson IoT client using the config file which is generated when you register your device * @param client - Reference to the Iotfclient * @param configFilePath - File path to the configuration file * * @return int return code * error codes * CONFIG_FILE_ERROR -3 - Config file not present or not in right format */

This project is trying to connect the bluemix IOT Platform.

"

Body: the project is not correctly laid out.  ALL *.c files need to be under the `src` section.   ALL *.h files need to be under the `Includes` section.  You need to make those corrections.  Eclipse will not compile random files.  Place those files in the correct sections of the project.
It's **declared** in `iotfclient.h`, but where is it **defined**?
Do you get warning on the #include line in you cabbie.c?
@ItayB I used to, when it was just `#include iotfclient.h". Then I changed it to `"../iotfclient.h"`"
The function initialize is declared in ../iotfclient.h, it might be defined in ../iotfclient.c, but do you compile this file and link it to your project?
Can you please add that in your answer?

@SharanDuggirala: not being an eclipse user, I don't know what kind of magic this IDE performs to implement the notion of *project*.  How do you build your program?  A Makefile would certainly help if you how to compose one and include it in the *project*.
There's a simple build button and then a run button
Look at the eclipse documentation to find out how you can put multiple source files in a *project* or how you can use a Makefile.

initialize() is declared in iotfclient.h. However, it's not necessary defined. In other words, the compiler knows identifier initialise stands for a function, but to create a program, you have also to tell the linker how the function works, that is, add the function body.

Try including ../iotfclient.c.
NONONO dp not be #include'ing a *.c file.  Fix the layout of the project instead.
@user3629249 You're right, *.c files are not designed for being included. Maybe copying the relevant function definition from ioftclient.c to cabbie.c will be a good practice?
